page.title: List of artworks known in English by a foreign title

revision.comment: Disambiguating links to [[Heroic]] (link changed to [[Heroic poetry]]) using [[User:Qwertyytrewqqwerty/DisamAssist|DisamAssist]].
revision.text:
{{incomplete list|date=August 2018}} The following is an alphabetical list of works of art that are often called by a non-English name in an English context. (Of course, many such titles are simply the names of people: ''[[Don Quixote]]'', ''[[Irma la Douce]]'', ''[[Madame Bovary]]'', ''[[Tosca]]'', ''[[Pelléas et Mélisande]]''. These have been omitted, as have examples where the English may easily be inferred: ''[[Symphonie fantastique]]'', ''[[Les liaisons dangereuses]]''.)
{| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Title !Transcription !Language !Translation !Description |- |[[99 Luftballons]]|| || [[German language|German]] || 99 Balloons || [[song]] by [[Nena]] |- |''[[À la recherche du temps perdu]]''|| || [[French language|French]] || ''In Search of Lost Time'' || [[novel]] by [[Marcel Proust]] |- |''[[Aberystwyth Mon Amour]]''|| || [[French language|French]] || ''Aberystwyth My Love'' || novel by [[Malcolm Pryce]] |- |''[[Aina (1977 film)|Aina]]''|| آئینہ || [[Urdu]] || ''Mirror'' || film directed by [[Nazr-ul-Islam]] |- |[[Alhambra]]|| الْحَمْرَاء || [[Arabic]] || The Red One || [[Muslim]] monument, located near [[Granada]], [[Spain]] |- |[[Angkor Wat]]|| អង្គរវត្ត || [[Khmer language|Khmer]] || temple complex of the city || [[Hindu]] and (later) [[Buddhist]] temple site, located in [[Angkor]], [[Cambodia]] |- |[[Arthashastra]]|| अर्थशास्त्रम् || [[Sanskrit]] || "science of politics" or "science of material gain" || treatise on statecraft, economic policy and military strategy |- |''[[Autobahn (album)|Autobahn]]''|| || [[German language|German]] || ''[[German Autobahn|Motorway]]'' || [[album]] and [[Autobahn (song)|song]] by [[Kraftwerk]] |- |''[[Bal (film)|Bal]]''|| || [[Turkish language|Turkish]] || ''Honey'' || film by [[Semih Kaplanoğlu]] |- |[[Barcarolle: une nuit à Lisbonne]]|| || [[French language|French]] || [[Barcarolle]]: A Night in [[Lisbon]] || [[symphonic poem]] by [[Camille Saint-Saëns]] |- |[[Bhagavad Gita]]|| भगवद्गीता || [[Sanskrit]] || Song of God || philosophical, [[Hindu]] book of poems (author contentious) |- |''[[Carmina Burana]]''|| || [[Latin]] || Songs from [[Benediktbeuern|Beuern]] || medieval book of poems and a [[Carmina Burana (Orff)|cantata]] by [[Carl Orff]] |- |[[Cavalleria rusticana]]|| || [[Italian language|Italian]] || Rustic Chivalry || opera by [[Pietro Mascagni]] |- |[[Chichen Itza]]|| || [[Yucatec Maya]] || At the Mouth of the Well of the [[Itza]] || [[Maya civilization|Mayan]] monument, located on the [[Yucatán Peninsula]], [[Mexico]] |- |''[[Commentarii de Bello Gallico]]''|| || [[Latin]] || ''Commentaries on the Gallic War'' || [[Julius Caesar]]'s firsthand account of the [[Gallic Wars]] |- |[[Codex Gigas]]|| || [[Latin]] || Giant Book || largest [[medieval]] [[manuscript]] in the world, the authorship is attributed to Hermann Inanclus (Herman, the Recluse), a monk |- |''[[Così fan tutte]]''|| || [[Italian language|Italian]] || ''That's What They [feminine] All Do'' || [[opera]] by [[Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart]] |- |[[Dai Miao]]|| 岱庙 || [[Chinese language|Chinese]] || [[Mount Tai|Dai]] Temple || [[Daoist]] temple complex, located on [[Mount Tai]], [[People's Republic of China]] |- |[[Dàin do Eimhir]]|| ||[[Scottish Gaelic]]|| Poems to [[Eimhir]] ||Sequence of poems by [[Sorley MacLean]] |- |''[[Dao De Jing]]''|| 道德经/道德經 || [[Chinese language|Chinese]] || Way/Path, Virtue, Guideline || philosophical, [[Daoist]]
